languageModelTools.name: list_scratches
languageModelTools.modelDescription:
Lists all scratch files in the user's scratch storage, optionally filtered by a glob pattern.
Use when user asks to see available scratches or find files by pattern.

Parameters:
- filter (optional): Glob pattern (e.g., "**/*.ts" for TypeScript, "**/notes/**" for directory)

Examples:
- {} → "scratch:///notes.md\nscratch:///todo.txt"
- { filter: "**/*.ts" } → "scratch:///code/example.ts"

Returns: Newline-separated URIs or "No scratches found."

filter.description: Filter to use when listing scratches. Can be a glob pattern or a directory path. If omitted, all scratches are listed. Only use if a specific directory or set of directories is needed, otherwise prefer leaving it empty and getting a full list instead.

languageModelTools.name: read_scratch
languageModelTools.userDescription: Reads content from a scratch file
languageModelTools.modelDescription:
Reads the content of a scratch file, optionally reading a specific line range.
Use when user asks to view or retrieve scratch content.

Parameters:
- uri (required): Scratch URI (e.g., "scratch:///notes.md") or URI string
- lineFrom (optional): Starting line number (0-based, inclusive)
- lineTo (optional): Ending line number (0-based, exclusive)

Examples:
- { uri: "scratch:///notes.md" } → full file content
- { uri: "scratch:///code.ts", lineFrom: 10, lineTo: 20 } → lines 10-19

Returns: File content as string.

uri.description: The scratch URI to read from. Must be a valid scratch:// URI or URI string.

lineFrom.description: Optional starting line number (0-based, inclusive). If omitted, reads from the beginning.

lineTo.description: Optional ending line number (0-based, exclusive). If omitted, reads to the end.

languageModelTools.name: write_scratch
languageModelTools.userDescription: Writes content to a scratch file
languageModelTools.modelDescription:
Writes content to a scratch file, creating it if it doesn't exist or overwriting if it does.
Use when user asks to save, create, or update scratch content.

Parameters:
- uri (required): Scratch URI (e.g., "scratch:///notes.md") or URI string
- content (required): Content to write to the file

Examples:
- { uri: "scratch:///notes.md", content: "My notes" } → creates/overwrites file
- { uri: "scratch:///code/test.ts", content: "const x = 1;" } → creates nested file

Returns: "Scratch written successfully.". After writing always provide a short (1-2 lines) sumary of changes made,

uri.description: The scratch URI to write to. Must be a valid scratch:// URI or URI string. Parent directories will be created if needed.

content.description: The content to write to the file. Will overwrite existing content if file exists.

languageModelTools.name: rename_scratch
languageModelTools.userDescription: Renames or moves a scratch file
languageModelTools.modelDescription:
Renames or moves a scratch file from one URI to another.
Use when user asks to rename or move a scratch file to a new location or name.

NOTE: This tool modifies the file system and cannot be undone. Always confirm the old and new URIs with the user before proceeding.

Parameters:
- oldUri (required): Current scratch URI (e.g., "scratch:///notes.md") or URI string
- newUri (required): New scratch URI (e.g., "scratch:///renamed-notes.md") or URI string

Examples:
- { oldUri: "scratch:///notes.md", newUri: "scratch:///notes-backup.md" } → renames file
- { oldUri: "scratch:///misc/todo.txt", newUri: "scratch:///lists/todo.txt" } → moves file

Returns: "Scratch renamed successfully."

oldUri.description: The current scratch URI to rename from. Must be a valid scratch:// URI or URI string.

newUri.description: The new scratch URI to rename to. Must be a valid scratch:// URI or URI string. Parent directories will be created if needed.

scratches.scratchDirectory.description: Directory where scratch files are stored, defaults to extension's global storage directory
